page.title: 04DEVIL'S DYKE FARM
page.content: At the{Devil's Dyke Farm}(Map Reference 260104)the crops that are grown are Winter wheat,Spring barley and kale (Cow feed).The farmer has about 50 cows each worth about Â£600. The cows are used for milk and the milk is sold to the{Milk Marketing {Board.}There are no sheep on the farm because of people walking their dogs on the{South Downs Way}and footpaths. When the cows grow too old to milk they are sent to{Haywards {Heath Market}for meat. None of the cows are bought, they are all bred on the farm.The farmer buys his seeds from local seed merchants. The land belongs to the Crown and was used for Army training during the 1939-1945 war. All the buildings were destroyed, including the disused Dyke Railway Station. New farm buildings now occupy that site.
